summary: Email chain between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney Laura Menninger and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding logistics for the defense team to review physical and electronic evidence in the criminal case. The correspondence details negotiations over evidence location (Bronx warehouse vs. 500 Pearl Street courthouse), handling of 'Highly Confidential' materials, and the schedule for Maxwell's presence during review.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Lead defense attorney negotiating evidence review logistics with the prosecution, representing Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on emails as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Christian R Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP copied on defense team emails.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on emails regarding evidence review logistics.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in case 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), whose presence at evidence review at 500 Pearl Street is being arranged by the Marshals.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the source of seized evidence from his residences, including electronic devices and images.

connections.description: Menninger is the defense attorney representing Maxwell in the criminal case.
Maxwell is charged in relation to Epstein's activities; evidence seized from Epstein's residences is central to the case.
Both are members of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, coordinating on evidence review.
Negotiating evidence review logistics and protective order designations in the criminal case.

events.title: Start of Evidence Review at 500 Pearl
events.description: Scheduled start date for Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team to review evidence at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse, with Maxwell produced by Marshals.

events.title: Bronx Warehouse Evidence Review
events.description: Defense team scheduled to review non-transportable evidence items at the FBI Bronx warehouse.

events.title: Interview Recording
events.description: Reference to an original recording of an interview dated April 24, 2007, which is part of the Florida evidence.

locations: 2350 Lafayette Ave, Bronx, NY (FBI Bronx warehouse)
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY (FBI office)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (Southern District of New York)
150 E. 10th Avenue, Denver, CO (Haddon, Morgan & Foreman law office)
keyFacts: The defense team sought to review all physical evidence, including items designated 'Highly Confidential' under a protective order, with Ghislaine Maxwell present.
Evidence included thousands of electronic images and videos seized from Jeffrey Epstein's devices, some containing nudity and designated as obscene material.
The FBI maintained a large volume of physical evidence at a Bronx warehouse, with some items deemed too bulky or fragile to transport to the courthouse.
Prosecution confirmed that non-testifying witness statements would be produced, and that the Marshals would produce Maxwell to 500 Pearl Street daily for evidence review.
The correspondence reveals detailed negotiations over defense access to evidence, including permissions to photograph items and the need for specialized equipment to review electronic media.
